H0.text: Autoinducers are the small molecules or proteins produced by bacteria that regulate gene expression.

H1.text: Fluxes are the small molecules or proteins produced by bacteria that regulate gene expression.

H2.text: Protazoas are the small molecules or proteins produced by bacteria that regulate gene expression.

H3.text: Sporozoans are the small molecules or proteins produced by bacteria that regulate gene expression.

A4.text: A bacteriumâ€™s detection of an autoinducer above some minimum threshold triggers altered gene expression.

A5.text: In turn, autoinducer-bound RhlR activates a second class of genes involved in later stages of infection, including genes needed for antibiotic production.
